#### Jason Lorenzo
>Nature communicates through data. Through a comprehensive analysis of these data, the IPCC were able to release [climate change reports](https://www.ipcc.ch/reports/) crucial for deciding the future of our planet and its inhabitants. Now, countries had made differing commitments, striking a balance between their economic, political, and moral standpoint. Hopefully, more and more people start to listen to data and the experts who study them. Nature calls us to be urgent.

```{r fig.align="center", warning=FALSE, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE}
library(ggplot2)
df <- read.csv("https://query.data.world/s/am4fth46ih4simnozstddx5qpvmqto", header=TRUE, stringsAsFactors=FALSE);
ggplot(df, aes(x=X2014)) +
  geom_histogram() +
  ggtitle("CO2 Emissions Per Capita of Countries in 2014") +
  xlab("Countries in Alphabetical Order") +
  ylab("CO2 (tons) Per Capita")
```
